</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// POST new user</span></span><span>

  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { name, email } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">body</span></span><span>;

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (?, ?)'</span></span><span>, [name, email]);

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// PUT update user</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'UPDATE users SET name = ?, email = ? WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [name, email, id]);
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'Utilisateur mis √† jour'</span></span><span> });
  } </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">catch</span></span><span> (err) {
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'Erreur serveur'</span></span><span> });
  }
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// DELETE user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">delete</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/:id'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> (req, res) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { id } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">params</span></span><span>;
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">try</span></span><span> {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'DELETE FROM users WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [id]);
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'Utilisateur supprim√©'</span></span><span> });

  }

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> router = express.</span><span><span class="hljs-title class_">Router</span></span><span>();
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> db = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">require</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'../db'</span></span><span>);

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// GET all users</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'SELECT * FROM users'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err, results</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>(results);
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// POST new user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">post</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { name, email } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">body</span></span><span>;
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (?, ?)'</span></span><span>, [name, email], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">201</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User added'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// PUT update user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">put</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/:id'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { name, email } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">body</span></span><span>;
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'UPDATE users SET name = ?, email = ? WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [name, email, req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">params</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">id</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User updated'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// DELETE user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">delete</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/:id'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'DELETE FROM users WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">params</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">id</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User deleted'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-variable language_">module</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">exports</span></span><span> = router;
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

WORKDIR /app

# Copier les fichiers package.json et package-lock.json
COPY package*.json ./

# Installer les d√©pendances

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> db = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">require</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'../db'</span></span><span>);

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// GET all users</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {

    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>(results);
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// POST new user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">post</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { name, email } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">body</span></span><span>;
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES (?, ?)'</span></span><span>, [name, email], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">201</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User added'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// PUT update user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">put</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/:id'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">const</span></span><span> { name, email } = req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">body</span></span><span>;
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'UPDATE users SET name = ?, email = ? WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [name, email, req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">params</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">id</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {

    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User updated'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment">// DELETE user</span></span><span>
router.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">delete</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'/:id'</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">req, res</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
  db.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">query</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'DELETE FROM users WHERE id = ?'</span></span><span>, [req.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">params</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">id</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-function">(<span class="hljs-params">err</span></span></span><span>) =&gt; {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> (err) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">status</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">500</span></span><span>).</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">error</span></span><span>: err });
    res.</span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">json</span></span><span>({ </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">message</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'User deleted'</span></span><span> });
  });
});

</span><span><span class="hljs-variable language_">module</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-property">exports</span></span><span> = router;

</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">frontend/src/compenents/UserList.js : import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import axios from "axios";

const UserManagement = () =&gt; {
  const [users, setUsers] = useState([]);
  const [name, setName] = useState("");
  const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
  const [editingUser, setEditingUser] = useState(null);

  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    fetchUsers();
  }, []);

  const fetchUsers = async () =&gt; {
    const res = await axios.get("http://localhost:5000/api/users");
    setUsers(res.data);
  };

  const handleSubmit = async (e) =&gt; {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (editingUser) {
      await axios.put(<code>http://localhost:5000/users/${editingUser.id}</code>, {
        name,
        email,
      });
      setEditingUser(null);
    } else {
      await axios.post("http://localhost:5000/users", { name, email });
    }
    setName("");
    setEmail("");
    fetchUsers();
  };

  const handleEdit = (user) =&gt; {
    setEditingUser(user);
    setName(user.name);
    setEmail(user.email);
  };

  const handleDelete = async (id) =&gt; {
    await axios.delete(<code>http://localhost:5000/users/${id}</code>);
    fetchUsers();
  };

  return (
    &lt;div style={styles.container}&gt;
      &lt;h1 style={styles.title}&gt;User Management&lt;/h1&gt;

      &lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit} style={styles.form}&gt;
        &lt;input
          style={styles.input}
          type="text"
          placeholder="Name"
          value={name}
          onChange={(e) =&gt; setName(e.target.value)}
          required
        /&gt;
        &lt;input
          style={styles.input}
          type="email"
          placeholder="Email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) =&gt; setEmail(e.target.value)}
          required
        /&gt;
        &lt;button style={styles.button} type="submit"&gt;
          {editingUser ? "Update User" : "Add User"}
        &lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/form&gt;

      &lt;ul style={styles.list}&gt;
        {users.map((user) =&gt; (
          &lt;li key={user.id} style={styles.listItem}&gt;
            {user.name} - {user.email}
            &lt;div&gt;
              &lt;button style={styles.editButton} onClick={() =&gt; handleEdit(user)}&gt;
                Edit
              &lt;/button&gt;
              &lt;button style={styles.deleteButton} onClick={() =&gt; handleDelete(user.id)}&gt;
                Delete
              &lt;/button&gt;
            &lt;/div&gt;
          &lt;/li&gt;
        ))}
      &lt;/ul&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
};

const styles = {
  container: {
    maxWidth: "600px",
    margin: "50px auto",
    padding: "30px",
    backgroundColor: "#f9f9f9",
    borderRadius: "15px",
    boxShadow: "0 4px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)",
  },
  title: {
    textAlign: "center",
    marginBottom: "20px",
    color: "#333",
  },
  form: {
    display: "flex",
    flexDirection: "column",
    gap: "10px",
    marginBottom: "20px",
  },
  input: {
    padding: "10px",
    borderRadius: "8px",
    border: "1px solid #ccc",
    fontSize: "16px",
  },
  button: {
    padding: "10px",
    borderRadius: "8px",
    background: "linear-gradient(45deg, #ff9a9e, #fad0c4)",
    border: "none",
    color: "white",
    fontWeight: "bold",
    cursor: "pointer",
  },
  list: {
    listStyle: "none",
    padding: 0,
  },
  listItem: {
    display: "flex",
    justifyContent: "space-between",
    padding: "10px",
    borderBottom: "1px solid #ddd",
  },
  editButton: {
    padding: "5px 10px",
    marginRight: "5px",
    borderRadius: "5px",
    background: "linear-gradient(45deg, #f6d365, #fda085)",
    border: "none",
    color: "white",
    cursor: "pointer",
  },
  deleteButton: {
    padding: "5px 10px",
    borderRadius: "5px",
    background: "linear-gradient(45deg, #f5576c, #f093fb)",
    border: "none",
    color: "white",
    cursor: "pointer",
  },
};

export default UserManagement;

const mysql = require('mysql2');

const app = express();
const port = 5000;

app.use(cors());
app.use(express.json());

const db = mysql.createConnection({
    host: 'localhost',
    user: 'root',
    password: 'root', 
    database: 'user_management'
});

db.connect((err) =&gt; {
    if (err) {
        console.log('Erreur de connexion √† la base de donn√©es: ', err);
    } else {
        console.log('Connect√© √† la base de donn√©es');
    }
});

// Routes pour g√©rer les utilisateurs
app.get('/users', (req, res) =&gt; {
    db.query('SELECT * FROM users', (err, results) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            res.status(500).json({ error: err.message });
        } else {
            res.status(200).json(results);
        }
    });
});

app.listen(port, () =&gt; {
    console.log(<code>Server is running on port ${port}</code>);
});

// Ajouter un utilisateur
app.post('/users', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { name, email, password } = req.body;
    const query = 'INSERT INTO users (name, email, password) VALUES (?, ?, ?)';

    db.query(query, [name, email, password], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de l\'ajout de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de l\'ajout de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.status(201).send('Utilisateur ajout√©');
        }
    });
});


// Modifier un utilisateur
app.put('/users/:id', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { name, email, password } = req.body;
    const { id } = req.params;

    const query = 'UPDATE users SET name = ?, email = ?, password = ? WHERE id = ?';
    db.query(query, [name, email, password, id], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de la modification de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de la modification de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.send('Utilisateur modifi√©');
        }
    });
});


// Supprimer un utilisateur
app.delete('/users/:id', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { id } = req.params;

    const query = 'DELETE FROM users WHERE id = ?';
    db.query(query, [id], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de la suppression de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de la suppression de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.send('Utilisateur supprim√©');
        }
    });
});

stage
FROM node:18 AS build

# Set the working directory inside the container
WORKDIR /app

# Copy the package.json and package-lock.json for installing dependencies
COPY backend/package*.json ./

# Install dependencies
RUN npm install

# Copy the rest of the application files
COPY backend/ .

# Expose the port on which the app will run
EXPOSE 5000

# Command to start the app
CMD ["npm", "start"]

<h3 data-start="771" data-end="791" class=""><strong data-start="775" data-end="790">Explanation</strong>:</h3>
<ul data-start="793" data-end="1142">
<li data-start="793" data-end="964" class="" style="">
<p data-start="795" data-end="964" class=""><strong data-start="795" data-end="816">Multi-stage build</strong>: First, we use a <strong data-start="834" data-end="849">build stage</strong> to install all dependencies (<code data-start="879" data-end="888">node:18</code>). Then, it copies the source files and optimizes for the actual deployment.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="965" data-end="1142" class="" style="">
<p data-start="967" data-end="1142" class=""><strong data-start="967" data-end="986">Optimized image</strong>: The build stage ensures the dependencies are installed only once, and the final container will only have what‚Äôs necessary to run the app (no build tools).</p>
</li>
</ul>

React app
FROM node:18 AS build

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package.json and package-lock.json for installing dependencies
COPY frontend/package*.json ./

# Install dependencies
RUN npm install

# Copy the rest of the application files
COPY frontend/ .

# Build the React app (production build)
RUN npm run build

# Stage 2: Serve the app using nginx
FROM nginx:alpine

# Copy the build folder from the build stage to nginx's default directory
COPY --from=build /app/build /usr/share/nginx/html

# Expose the port on which nginx will serve the app
EXPOSE 80

# Command to run nginx
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]
</span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="2071" data-end="2091" class=""><strong data-start="2075" data-end="2090">Explanation</strong>:</h3>
<ul data-start="2093" data-end="2420">
<li data-start="2093" data-end="2222" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2095" data-end="2222" class=""><strong data-start="2095" data-end="2110">First stage</strong>: We use <code data-start="2119" data-end="2128">node:18</code> to install dependencies and build the React application in production mode (<code data-start="2205" data-end="2220">npm run build</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2223" data-end="2315" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2225" data-end="2315" class=""><strong data-start="2225" data-end="2241">Second stage</strong>: We use <code data-start="2250" data-end="2257">nginx</code> to serve the static files generated from the React build.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2316" data-end="2420" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2318" data-end="2420" class=""><strong data-start="2318" data-end="2338">Optimized assets</strong>: The production build of React optimizes JavaScript and CSS files to reduce size.</p>
</li>
</ul>

      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">app-network</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">ports:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"3306:3306"</span></span><span>

  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Frontend service (React app) [Optional]</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">frontend:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">build:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">context:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">.</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">dockerfile:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">frontend/Dockerfile</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">ports:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"80:80"</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">networks:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">app-network</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">volumes:</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">mysql-data:</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">networks:</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">app-network:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">driver:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">bridge</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="3547" data-end="3567" class=""><strong data-start="3551" data-end="3566">Explanation</strong>:</h3>
<ul data-start="3569" data-end="4646">
<li data-start="3569" data-end="3933" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3571" data-end="3583" class=""><strong data-start="3571" data-end="3582">Backend</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="3586" data-end="3933">
<li data-start="3586" data-end="3653" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3588" data-end="3653" class="">The <code data-start="3592" data-end="3601">backend</code> service builds the image from <code data-start="3632" data-end="3652">backend/Dockerfile</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3656" data-end="3684" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3658" data-end="3684" class="">It listens on port <code data-start="3677" data-end="3683">5000</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3687" data-end="3750" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3689" data-end="3750" class=""><strong data-start="3689" data-end="3714">Environment variables</strong> are configured to connect to MySQL.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3753" data-end="3832" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3755" data-end="3832" class="">It <strong data-start="3758" data-end="3790">depends on the MySQL service</strong> to ensure it starts after MySQL is ready.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3835" data-end="3930" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3837" data-end="3930" class="">The <code data-start="3841" data-end="3850">volumes</code> directive mounts the backend code to the container for development convenience.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="3934" data-end="4222" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3936" data-end="3946" class=""><strong data-start="3936" data-end="3945">MySQL</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="3949" data-end="4222">
<li data-start="3949" data-end="4070" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3951" data-end="4070" class="">The <code data-start="3955" data-end="3962">mysql</code> service uses the official <code data-start="3989" data-end="4000">mysql:8.0</code> image and sets up the root password and database (<code data-start="4051" data-end="4068">user_management</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4073" data-end="4142" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4075" data-end="4142" class="">The database data is persisted using a named volume (<code data-start="4128" data-end="4140">mysql-data</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4145" data-end="4222" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4147" data-end="4222" class="">The <code data-start="4151" data-end="4162">3306:3306</code> port mapping allows external access to the MySQL container.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="4224" data-end="4378" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4226" data-end="4250" class=""><strong data-start="4226" data-end="4249">Frontend (Optional)</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="4253" data-end="4378">
<li data-start="4253" data-end="4326" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4255" data-end="4326" class="">The <code data-start="4259" data-end="4269">frontend</code> service builds the React app from <code data-start="4304" data-end="4325">frontend/Dockerfile</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="4329" data-end="4378" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4331" data-end="4378" class="">It serves the React app via nginx on port <code data-start="4373" data-end="4377">80</code>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="4380" data-end="4489" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4382" data-end="4397" class=""><strong data-start="4382" data-end="4396">Networking</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="4400" data-end="4489">
<li data-start="4400" data-end="4489" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4402" data-end="4489" class="">We define a custom network (<code data-start="4430" data-end="4443">app-network</code>) to allow communication between the services.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="4491" data-end="4646" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4493" data-end="4505" class=""><strong data-start="4493" data-end="4504">Volumes</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="4508" data-end="4646">
<li data-start="4508" data-end="4646" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4510" data-end="4646" class=""><strong data-start="4510" data-end="4536">MySQL data persistence</strong>: The <code data-start="4542" data-end="4554">mysql-data</code> volume ensures that MySQL data is not lost when the container is stopped and started again.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="4648" data-end="4651" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="4653" data-end="4695" class=""><strong data-start="4657" data-end="4695">4. Configure Environment Variables</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="4697" data-end="4793">
<li data-start="4697" data-end="4793" class="" style="">
<p data-start="4699" data-end="4793" class="">Create a <code data-start="4708" data-end="4714">.env</code> file in the <code data-start="4727" data-end="4737">backend/</code> directory to store your environment variables securely.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="4795" data-end="4873"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div <p data-start="4875" data-end="4940" class="">The backend will read these values via <code data-start="4914" data-end="4927">process.env</code> in the code.</p>
<hr data-start="4942" data-end="4945" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="4947" data-end="4993" class=""><strong data-start="4951" data-end="4993">5. Build and Run the Docker Containers</strong></h3>
<p data-start="4995" data-end="5103" class="">After setting up all the Dockerfiles and Docker Compose file, you can <strong data-start="5065" data-end="5097">build and run the containers</strong> with:</p>

<p data-start="5144" data-end="5162" class="">This command will:</p>
<ol data-start="5164" data-end="5347">
<li data-start="5164" data-end="5257" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5167" data-end="5257" class="">Build the Docker images for the backend and frontend (if you want to serve the React app).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5258" data-end="5285" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5261" data-end="5285" class="">Start the MySQL service.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5286" data-end="5347" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5289" data-end="5347" class="">Connect all the services through the custom <code data-start="5333" data-end="5346">app-network</code>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5349" data-end="5352" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="5354" data-end="5387" class=""><strong data-start="5358" data-end="5387">6. Access the Application</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="5389" data-end="5586">
<li data-start="5389" data-end="5459" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5391" data-end="5459" class=""><strong data-start="5391" data-end="5406">Backend API</strong>: You can access your API at <code data-start="5435" data-end="5458">http://localhost:5000</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5460" data-end="5586" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5462" data-end="5586" class=""><strong data-start="5462" data-end="5484">Frontend React App</strong>: You can access your React app at <code data-start="5519" data-end="5537">http://localhost</code> (or port <code data-start="5547" data-end="5551">80</code> if you don't map to another port).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="5588" data-end="5591" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5593" data-end="5691" class="">By following these steps, you'll have a <strong data-start="5633" data-end="5676">fully Dockerized full-stack application</strong> that includes:</p>
<ol data-start="5693" data-end="5879">
<li data-start="5693" data-end="5746" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5696" data-end="5746" class="">A backend (Express) connected to a MySQL database.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5747" data-end="5798" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5750" data-end="5798" class="">A frontend (React) optionally served with nginx.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="5799" data-end="5879" class="" style="">
<p data-start="5802" data-end="5879" class="">A <code data-start="5804" data-end="5824">docker-compose.yml</code> file to tie everything together and manage containers.</p>
</li>
</ol>

FROM node:20-alpine AS build

WORKDIR /app

# Copy the package.json and package-lock.json first to install dependencies
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install --production

# Copy the rest of the app
COPY . .

# -------- Etape 2 : Run --------
FROM node:20-alpine

WORKDIR /app

# Copy everything from the build stage
COPY --from=build /app /app

# Expose the port on which your backend will run

# Start the server using your main server file (e.g., server.js)
CMD ["node", "server.js"]

<hr data-start="1021" data-end="1024" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="1026" data-end="1066" class=""><strong data-start="1030" data-end="1066">Why this Dockerfile should work:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1068" data-end="1584">
<li data-start="1068" data-end="1290" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1070" data-end="1290" class=""><strong data-start="1070" data-end="1091">Multi-stage build</strong>: The build stage installs dependencies (<code data-start="1132" data-end="1158">npm install --production</code>), and then in the run stage, it copies everything needed to run the app, which avoids keeping unnecessary files in the final image.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1294" data-end="1424" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1296" data-end="1424" class=""><strong data-start="1296" data-end="1315">Optimized image</strong>: The <code data-start="1321" data-end="1337">node:20-alpine</code> image is a minimal version of Node.js, which helps keep the image small and efficient.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1428" data-end="1584" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1430" data-end="1584" class=""><strong data-start="1430" data-end="1452">Correct file paths</strong>: The <code data-start="1458" data-end="1464">COPY</code> command copies the relevant files at each stage, making sure that only the necessary files for production are included.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1586" data-end="1589" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="1591" data-end="1632" class=""><strong data-start="1595" data-end="1632">Modifications to Your Dockerfile:</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="1634" data-end="2307">
<li data-start="1634" data-end="1975" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1637" data-end="1975" class=""><strong data-start="1637" data-end="1671">Install dependencies only once</strong>: In your Dockerfile, you have <code data-start="1702" data-end="1728">npm install --production</code> which is great, but make sure you copy the <code data-start="1772" data-end="1786">package.json</code> and <code data-start="1791" data-end="1810">package-lock.json</code> files before copying the rest of the app files. This ensures Docker caches the dependencies layer to avoid reinstalling dependencies unless <code data-start="1951" data-end="1966">package*.json</code> changes.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1979" data-end="2097" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1982" data-end="2097" class=""><strong data-start="1982" data-end="2011">Correct working directory</strong>: You have the right working directory set up (<code data-start="2058" data-end="2064">/app</code>), so no changes are needed here.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2099" data-end="2307" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2102" data-end="2307" class=""><strong data-start="2102" data-end="2143">Copy the app files in the build stage</strong>: You're correctly copying the rest of the app after installing dependencies. This is important to avoid unnecessary copying of files before the <code data-start="2288" data-end="2301">npm install</code> step.</p>
</li>
</ol>

FROM node:18 AS build

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package.json and package-lock.json to install dependencies
COPY frontend/package*.json ./

# Install all dependencies, including Bootstrap
RUN npm install

# Copy the rest of the frontend files
COPY frontend/ .

# Build the React app
RUN npm run build

# -------- Etape 2 : Serve the frontend --------
FROM nginx:alpine

# Copy the build output to Nginx's public directory
COPY --from=build /app/build /usr/share/nginx/html

# Expose the port Nginx is running on
EXPOSE 80

CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]

<p data-start="1259" data-end="1416" class="">If your application is configured to run on a different port (e.g., <code data-start="1327" data-end="1350">http://localhost:3000</code>), make sure the port mapping is set in your <code data-start="1395" data-end="1415">docker-compose.yml</code>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1418" data-end="1442" class="">4. <strong data-start="1425" data-end="1442">Troubleshoot:</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1446" data-end="1479" class="">If the application isn't loading:</p>
<ul data-start="1483" data-end="1793">
<li data-start="1483" data-end="1544" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1485" data-end="1544" class="">Ensure there are no errors in your <strong data-start="1520" data-end="1529">nginx</strong> configuration.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1548" data-end="1698" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1550" data-end="1698" class="">If the backend is not connecting to the frontend, ensure the <strong data-start="1611" data-end="1622">API URL</strong> is correctly configured in your frontend to point to the backend container.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1702" data-end="1793" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1704" data-end="1793" class="">If there are database issues, verify the connection and authentication details for MySQL.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h3 data-start="1697" data-end="1742" class="">4. <strong data-start="1704" data-end="1742">Check Docker Network Connectivity:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1746" data-end="1887">
<li data-start="1746" data-end="1829" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1748" data-end="1829" class="">Ensure that the frontend container can communicate with the backend if necessary.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1833" data-end="1887" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1835" data-end="1887" class="">Make sure the backend API is running and accessible.</p>
</li>
</ul>

class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="224" class="">Yes, you can use Docker Desktop to visually manage and inspect your containers and images. Docker Desktop provides a GUI (graphical user interface) that makes it easier to interact with your containers, images, and networks.</p>
<p data-start="226" data-end="311" class="">Here‚Äôs how to use Docker Desktop to monitor the status of your containers and images:</p>
<h3 data-start="313" data-end="343" class="">1. <strong data-start="320" data-end="343">Open Docker Desktop</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="347" data-end="392">
<li data-start="347" data-end="392" class="" style="">
<p data-start="349" data-end="392" class="">Launch <strong data-start="356" data-end="374">Docker Desktop</strong> on your computer.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="394" data-end="428" class="">2. <strong data-start="401" data-end="428">View Running Containers</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="432" data-end="933">
<li data-start="432" data-end="539" class="" style="">
<p data-start="434" data-end="539" class="">In the <strong data-start="441" data-end="462">Containers / Apps</strong> tab (on the left panel), you will see a list of all your running containers.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="543" data-end="627" class="" style="">
<p data-start="545" data-end="627" class="">Containers will show their <strong data-start="572" data-end="581">names</strong>, <strong data-start="583" data-end="593">status</strong>, <strong data-start="595" data-end="612">ports exposed</strong>, and <strong data-start="618" data-end="626">logs</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="631" data-end="750" class="" style="">
<p data-start="633" data-end="750" class="">You can click on each container to inspect more details like logs, environment variables, network settings, and more.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="758" data-end="933" class="" style="">
<p data-start="760" data-end="933" class="">If your container is not running, you‚Äôll see its status as "Exited" or "Created". You can start, stop, or restart the containers using the <strong data-start="899" data-end="908">Start</strong> and <strong data-start="913" data-end="924">Restart</strong> buttons.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="935" data-end="957" class="">3. <strong data-start="942" data-end="957">View Images</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="961" data-end="1419">
<li data-start="961" data-end="1091" class="" style="">
<p data-start="963" data-end="1091" class="">Switch to the <strong data-start="977" data-end="987">Images</strong> tab on the left sidebar. Here, you will see a list of all Docker images available on your local system.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1095" data-end="1157" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1097" data-end="1157" class="">You can see the size, repository, tag, and ID of each image.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1161" data-end="1296" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1163" data-end="1296" class="">If your containers are created from a specific image, you can verify the image status here and see if it‚Äôs built or pulled correctly.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1300" data-end="1419" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1302" data-end="1419" class="">You can delete images by clicking on the <strong data-start="1343" data-end="1357">Trash Icon</strong> or use the "Run" button to launch a container from the image.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1421" data-end="1441" class="">4. <strong data-start="1428" data-end="1441">View Logs</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1445" data-end="1752">
<li data-start="1445" data-end="1520" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1447" data-end="1520" class="">For running containers, you can view the logs directly in Docker Desktop.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1524" data-end="1752" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1526" data-end="1752" class="">Click on the container name in the <strong data-start="1561" data-end="1582">Containers / Apps</strong> tab, then go to the <strong data-start="1603" data-end="1611">Logs</strong> tab. You can see both <strong data-start="1634" data-end="1644">stdout</strong> and <strong data-start="1649" data-end="1659">stderr</strong> logs, which will give you information about the container's activities and potential issues.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="1754" data-end="1787" class="">5. <strong data-start="1761" data-end="1787">Monitor Resource Usage</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1791" data-end="2147">
<li data-start="1791" data-end="1997" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1793" data-end="1997" class="">Docker Desktop also provides insights into resource usage (CPU, memory, disk usage) for containers and images. This can be helpful to monitor if your application is consuming more resources than expected.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2005" data-end="2147" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2007" data-end="2147" class="">In the <strong data-start="2014" data-end="2027">Dashboard</strong> section, you‚Äôll see a graphical representation of the system‚Äôs resource usage, along with individual containers' stats.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2149" data-end="2182" class="">6. <strong data-start="2156" data-end="2182">Networking and Volumes</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2186" data-end="2629">
<li data-start="2186" data-end="2344" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2188" data-end="2344" class="">You can also inspect the <strong data-start="2213" data-end="2225">Networks</strong> and <strong data-start="2230" data-end="2241">Volumes</strong> sections to see how your containers are connected and which persistent storage volumes they are using.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2349" data-end="2492" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2351" data-end="2492" class="">In <strong data-start="2354" data-end="2366">Networks</strong>, you can view the different Docker networks created by your services. Each container will be connected to a specific network.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2496" data-end="2629" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2498" data-end="2629" class="">In <strong data-start="2501" data-end="2512">Volumes</strong>, you‚Äôll see any volumes created by containers (for persistent storage). You can inspect the data stored within them.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2631" data-end="2671" class="">7. <strong data-start="2638" data-end="2671">Rebuild or Restart Containers</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2675" data-end="2879">
<li data-start="2675" data-end="2766" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2677" data-end="2766" class="">From the <strong data-start="2686" data-end="2707">Containers / Apps</strong> tab, you can easily stop, start, or restart any container.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2770" data-end="2879" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2772" data-end="2879" class="">If you need to rebuild a container, you can go back to the terminal and re-run <code data-start="2851" data-end="2878">docker-compose up --build</code>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2881" data-end="2919" class="">8. <strong data-start="2888" data-end="2919">Check for Errors and Alerts</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="2923" data-end="3171">
<li data-start="2923" data-end="3018" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2925" data-end="3018" class="">Docker Desktop will also show you any system or container errors directly in the application.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3022" data-end="3171" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3024" data-end="3171" class="">If there are any issues like network failures, permission errors, or build issues, Docker Desktop will typically give you alerts or error messages.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="3173" data-end="3433" class="">By using Docker Desktop, you have an easy way to monitor and manage your Docker containers and images without needing to rely solely on the terminal. If your containers are still not running properly, the <strong data-start="3378" data-end="3386">Logs</strong> section should give you a good clue as to why.</p>
<p data-start="3435" data-end="3505" class="">Let me know if you need help with any specific part in Docker Desktop!</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex absolute right-0 left-0 flex require('express');
const cors = require('cors');
const mysql = require('mysql2');

const app = express();
const port = 5000;

app.use(cors());
app.use(express.json());

// Connexion √† la base de donn√©es MySQL
const db = mysql.createConnection({
    host: 'localhost',
    user: 'root',
    password: 'root', 
    database: 'user_management'
});

db.connect((err) =&gt; {
    if (err) {
        console.log('Erreur de connexion √† la base de donn√©es: ', err);
    } else {
        console.log('Connect√© √† la base de donn√©es');
    }
});

// Routes pour g√©rer les utilisateurs
app.get('/users', (req, res) =&gt; {
    db.query('SELECT * FROM users', (err, results) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            res.status(500).json({ error: err.message });
        } else {
            res.status(200).json(results);
        }
    });
});

// Route par d√©faut pour v√©rifier que le serveur fonctionne
app.get('/', (req, res) =&gt; {
    res.send('API User Management fonctionne üéâ');
  });
  

app.listen(port, () =&gt; {
    console.log(<code>Server is running on port ${port}</code>);
});

// Ajouter un utilisateur
app.post('/users', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { name, email, password } = req.body;
    const query = 'INSERT INTO users (name, email, password) VALUES (?, ?, ?)';

    db.query(query, [name, email, password], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de l\'ajout de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de l\'ajout de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.status(201).send('Utilisateur ajout√©');
        }
    });
});


// Modifier un utilisateur
app.put('/users/:id', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { name, email, password } = req.body;
    const { id } = req.params;

    const query = 'UPDATE users SET name = ?, email = ?, password = ? WHERE id = ?';
    db.query(query, [name, email, password, id], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de la modification de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de la modification de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.send('Utilisateur modifi√©');
        }
    });
});


// Supprimer un utilisateur
app.delete('/users/:id', (req, res) =&gt; {
    const { id } = req.params;

    const query = 'DELETE FROM users WHERE id = ?';
    db.query(query, [id], (err, result) =&gt; {
        if (err) {
            console.error('Erreur lors de la suppression de l\'utilisateur :', err);
            res.status(500).send('Erreur lors de la suppression de l\'utilisateur');
        } else {
            res.send('Utilisateur supprim√©');
        }
    });
});

<h3 data-start="1186" data-end="1217" class="">3. <strong data-start="1193" data-end="1217">View the HTML report</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1218" data-end="1431" class="">After running the command, you should see the coverage report inside the <code data-start="1291" data-end="1301">coverage</code> folder in your project directory. Open the <code data-start="1345" data-end="1357">index.html</code> file in that folder in your browser to view the detailed coverage report.</p>
<h3 data-start="1433" data-end="1469" class="">4. <strong data-start="1440" data-end="1469">Check the terminal output</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1470" data-end="1589" class="">Additionally, the terminal should show you a summary of the coverage in a text format (because of the <code data-start="1572" data-end="1578">text</code> reporter).</p>
<hr data-start="1591" data-end="1594" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="1596" data-end="1606" class="">Recap:</h3>
<ul data-start="1608" data-end="1821">
<li data-start="1608" data-end="1696" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1610" data-end="1696" class=""><strong data-start="1610" data-end="1636">Create a <code data-start="1621" data-end="1634">.nycrc.json</code></strong> file with the configuration for generating the HTML report.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1697" data-end="1732" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1699" data-end="1732" class=""><strong data-start="1699" data-end="1725">Run <code data-start="1705" data-end="1723">npm run coverage</code></strong> again.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1733" data-end="1821" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1735" data-end="1821" class=""><strong data-start="1735" data-end="1766">Check the <code data-start="1747" data-end="1757">coverage</code> folder</strong> for the <code data-start="1775" data-end="1787">index.html</code> file to view the coverage report.</p>
</li>
</ul>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">on:</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">steps:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Checkout du repository</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Checkout</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">code</span></span><span>

      </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Setup de Node.js</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Setup</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Node.js</span></span><span>

<h3 data-start="1693" data-end="1734" class="">3. Configuration des Secrets GitHub :</h3>
<p data-start="1735" data-end="1840" class="">Vous devrez configurer des secrets pour Docker Hub et SSH dans les param√®tres de votre repository GitHub.</p>
<ul data-start="1842" data-end="2061">
<li data-start="1842" data-end="1901" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1844" data-end="1901" class=""><strong data-start="1844" data-end="1863">DOCKER_USERNAME</strong> : Votre nom d'utilisateur Docker Hub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1902" data-end="1978" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1904" data-end="1978" class=""><strong data-start="1904" data-end="1923">DOCKER_PASSWORD</strong> : Votre mot de passe Docker Hub (ou un token d'acc√®s).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1979" data-end="2061" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1981" data-end="2061" class=""><strong data-start="1981" data-end="2000">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</strong> : La cl√© priv√©e SSH pour vous connecter √† votre serveur VPS.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="2063" data-end="2094" class="">4. Explication des √©tapes :</h3>
<ol data-start="2095" data-end="2797">
<li data-start="2095" data-end="2173" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2098" data-end="2173" class=""><strong data-start="2098" data-end="2118">Checkout du repo</strong> : <code data-start="2121" data-end="2142">actions/checkout@v2</code> pour r√©cup√©rer le code source.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2174" data-end="2261" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2177" data-end="2261" class=""><strong data-start="2177" data-end="2194">Setup Node.js</strong> : <code data-start="2197" data-end="2220">actions/setup-node@v2</code> pour configurer l'environnement Node.js.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2262" data-end="2348" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2265" data-end="2348" class=""><strong data-start="2265" data-end="2297">Installation des d√©pendances</strong> : Installation des d√©pendances avec <code data-start="2334" data-end="2347">npm install</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2349" data-end="2413" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2352" data-end="2413" class=""><strong data-start="2352" data-end="2375">Lancement des tests</strong> : Ex√©cution des tests via <code data-start="2402" data-end="2412">npm test</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2414" data-end="2491" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2417" data-end="2491" class=""><strong data-start="2417" data-end="2439">Build Docker image</strong> : Cr√©ation d'une image Docker de votre application.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2492" data-end="2613" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2495" data-end="2613" class=""><strong data-start="2495" data-end="2530">Push de l'image vers Docker Hub</strong> : Utilisation des secrets pour se connecter √† Docker Hub et pousser l'image cr√©√©e.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2614" data-end="2797" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2617" data-end="2797" class=""><strong data-start="2617" data-end="2652">D√©ploiement sur serveur via SSH</strong> : Si vous avez un serveur √† d√©ployer, cette √©tape vous permet de vous connecter via SSH et d√©ployer automatiquement l'application en production.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h3 data-start="2799" data-end="2839" class="">5. Ajouter les secrets dans GitHub :</h3>
<ol data-start="2840" data-end="3027">
<li data-start="2840" data-end="2896" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2843" data-end="2896" class="">Allez dans les param√®tres de votre repository GitHub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2897" data-end="2944" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2900" data-end="2944" class="">Cliquez sur "Secrets" dans le menu √† gauche.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2945" data-end="3027" class="" style="">
<p data-start="2948" data-end="3027" class="">Ajoutez les secrets <code data-start="2968" data-end="2985">DOCKER_USERNAME</code>, <code data-start="2987" data-end="3004">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code>, et <code data-start="3009" data-end="3026">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</code>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="3029" data-end="3220" class="">Cela devrait configurer votre pipeline CI/CD pour les √©tapes que vous souhaitez automatiser. <h3 data-start="98" data-end="151" class="">1. <strong data-start="105" data-end="151">Create the <code data-start="118" data-end="144">.github/workflows/ci.yml</code> file</strong></h3>
<p data-start="156" data-end="207" class="">If you haven't done so already, follow these steps:</p>
<ul data-start="215" data-end="416">
<li data-start="215" data-end="284" class="" style="">
<p data-start="217" data-end="284" class="">Create a <code data-start="226" data-end="245">.github/workflows</code> directory in the root of your project.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="292" data-end="416" class="" style="">
<p data-start="294" data-end="416" class="">Inside this directory, create a new file called <code data-start="342" data-end="350">ci.yml</code> (this is where the GitHub Actions configuration will be written).</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h3 data-start="3091" data-end="3142" class="">3. <strong data-start="3098" data-end="3142">Configure GitHub Secrets for credentials</strong></h3>
<p data-start="3144" data-end="3292" class="">To securely store and use sensitive information like Docker Hub credentials and SSH keys, you need to configure GitHub secrets. Here‚Äôs how to do it:</p>
<ul data-start="3294" data-end="3794">
<li data-start="3294" data-end="3328" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3296" data-end="3328" class="">Go to your repository on GitHub.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3329" data-end="3361" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3331" data-end="3361" class="">Click on the <strong data-start="3344" data-end="3356">Settings</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3362" data-end="3437" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3364" data-end="3437" class="">In the left sidebar, click on <strong data-start="3394" data-end="3405">Secrets</strong> under the <strong data-start="3416" data-end="3428">Security</strong> section.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3438" data-end="3483" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3440" data-end="3483" class="">Click the <strong data-start="3450" data-end="3475">New repository secret</strong> button.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3484" data-end="3794" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3486" data-end="3512" class="">Add the following secrets:</p>
<ul data-start="3515" data-end="3794">
<li data-start="3515" data-end="3562" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3517" data-end="3562" class=""><code data-start="3517" data-end="3534">DOCKER_USERNAME</code> ‚Äî Your Docker Hub username.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3565" data-end="3628" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3567" data-end="3628" class=""><code data-start="3567" data-end="3584">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code> ‚Äî Your Docker Hub password or access token.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3631" data-end="3794" class="" style="">
<p data-start="3633" data-end="3794" class=""><code data-start="3633" data-end="3650">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</code> ‚Äî Your private SSH key for accessing your server (ensure that the corresponding public key is added to your server‚Äôs <code data-start="3768" data-end="3792">~/.ssh/authorized_keys</code>).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">CI/CD</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Pipeline</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">on:</span></span><span>
  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">push:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">branches:</span></span><span>

  </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">pull_request:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">branches:</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">main</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-attr">jobs:</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">runs-on:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">ubuntu-latest</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">steps:</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Checkout</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">repository</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">uses:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">actions/checkout@v2</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Set</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">up</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Node.js</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">uses:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">actions/setup-node@v2</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">with:</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">node-version:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'16'</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Install</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">dependencies</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">npm</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">install</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Run</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">tests</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">npm</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">test</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Build</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">image</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
        docker build -t your-dockerhub-username/your-image-name .
</span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Log</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">in</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">to</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Hub</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">uses:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">docker/login-action@v2</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">with:</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">username:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">${{</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">}}</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">password:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">${{</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">}}</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Push</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">image</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">to</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Docker</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Hub</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|
        docker push your-dockerhub-username/your-image-name
</span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">name:</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">Deploy</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">to</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">server</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">via</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">SSH</span></span><span>
      </span><span><span class="hljs-attr">run:</span></span><span> <span class="hljs-string">|

</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<p data-start="5141" data-end="5278" class="">This will trigger the GitHub Actions workflow whenever a commit is pushed to the <code data-start="5222" data-end="5228">main</code> branch (or a pull request is merged into <code data-start="5270" data-end="5276">main</code>).</p>
<h3 data-start="5280" data-end="5310" class="">6. <strong data-start="5287" data-end="5310">Verify the workflow</strong></h3>

<p data-start="90" data-end="117" class="">Here‚Äôs what you need to do:</p>
<ol data-start="119" data-end="565">
<li data-start="119" data-end="202" class="" style="">
<p data-start="122" data-end="202" class="">After you push the changes to the repository, go to your GitHub repository page.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="203" data-end="313" class="" style="">
<p data-start="206" data-end="313" class="">You should see the <strong data-start="225" data-end="236">Actions</strong> tab along with other tabs like <strong data-start="268" data-end="276">Code</strong>, <strong data-start="278" data-end="288">Issues</strong>, <strong data-start="290" data-end="307">Pull Requests</strong>, etc.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="314" data-end="346" class="" style="">
<p data-start="317" data-end="346" class="">Click on the <strong data-start="330" data-end="341">Actions</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="347" data-end="565" class="" style="">
<p data-start="350" data-end="565" class="">In the Actions tab, you will see a list of workflows that have run or are in progress. If you pushed your changes to the <code data-start="471" data-end="477">main</code> branch or created a pull request, the GitHub Actions workflow should run automatically.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="567" data-end="776" class="">This is where you can see the logs of each step in the workflow (checkout, install dependencies, tests, Docker image build, etc.), and it will show whether everything worked successfully or if any step failed.</p>

After pushing your <code data-start="26" data-end="52">.github/workflows/ci.yml</code> file and opening the <strong data-start="74" data-end="85">Actions</strong> tab, here's what to do <strong data-start="109" data-end="117">next</strong> to complete <strong data-start="130" data-end="167">Partie 4 : GitHub Actions ‚Äì CI/CD</strong>:</p>
<hr data-start="170" data-end="173" class="" style="">
<h3 data-start="175" data-end="235" class="">‚úÖ <strong data-start="181" data-end="234">Step-by-step ‚Äì What to do after creating <code data-start="224" data-end="232">ci.yml</code></strong>:</h3>
<hr data-start="237" data-end="240" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="242" data-end="296" class="">‚úÖ 1. <strong data-start="252" data-end="296">Verify that the CI workflow is triggered</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="297" data-end="614">
<li data-start="297" data-end="614" class="" style="">
<p data-start="299" data-end="331" class="">After pushing the <code data-start="317" data-end="325">ci.yml</code> file:</p>
<ul data-start="334" data-end="614">
<li data-start="334" data-end="358" class="" style="">
<p data-start="336" data-end="358" class="">Go to <strong data-start="342" data-end="353">Actions</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="361" data-end="464" class="" style="">
<p data-start="363" data-end="464" class="">You should see a workflow run starting automatically (if it's triggered on <code data-start="438" data-end="444">push</code> or <code data-start="448" data-end="462">pull_request</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="467" data-end="512" class="" style="">
<p data-start="469" data-end="512" class="">Click on the workflow run to <strong data-start="498" data-end="511">view logs</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="515" data-end="614" class="" style="">
<p data-start="517" data-end="614" class="">Make sure all steps: checkout, setup Node.js, install dependencies, run tests, etc., <strong data-start="602" data-end="613">succeed</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="616" data-end="619" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="621" data-end="670" class="">‚úÖ 2. <strong data-start="631" data-end="670">Set up Docker Hub Secrets on GitHub</strong></h4>
<p data-start="672" data-end="757" class="">Before the workflow can push to Docker Hub, you need to configure <strong data-start="738" data-end="756">GitHub Secrets</strong>:</p>
<ol data-start="759" data-end="1078">
<li data-start="759" data-end="785" class="" style="">
<p data-start="762" data-end="785" class="">Go to your GitHub repo.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="786" data-end="881" class="" style="">
<p data-start="789" data-end="881" class="">Click on <strong data-start="798" data-end="810">Settings</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="813" data-end="838">Secrets and variables</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="841" data-end="852">Actions</strong> &gt; <strong data-start="855" data-end="880">New repository secret</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="882" data-end="1078" class="" style="">
<p data-start="885" data-end="911" class="">Add the following secrets:</p>
<ul data-start="915" data-end="1078">
<li data-start="915" data-end="961" class="" style="">
<p data-start="917" data-end="961" class=""><code data-start="917" data-end="934">DOCKER_USERNAME</code> ‚Üí your Docker Hub username</p>
</li>
<li data-start="965" data-end="1078" class="" style="">
<p data-start="967" data-end="1078" class=""><code data-start="967" data-end="984">DOCKER_PASSWORD</code> ‚Üí your Docker Hub password or <a data-start="1015" data-end="1078" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="">Docker access token</a></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="1080" data-end="1127" class="">üìå You'll use these in your <code data-start="1108" data-end="1116">ci.yml</code> like this:</p>

<p data-start="1589" data-end="1647" class="">Replace with your real Docker Hub username and image name.</p>
<p data-start="1649" data-end="1654" class="">Then:</p>
<ul data-start="1655" data-end="1808">
<li data-start="1655" data-end="1678" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1657" data-end="1678" class="">Push to GitHub again.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1679" data-end="1707" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1681" data-end="1707" class="">Watch the <strong data-start="1691" data-end="1702">Actions</strong> tab.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1708" data-end="1808" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1710" data-end="1808" class="">If successful, your image should be visible on your <a data-start="1762" data-end="1807" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="">Docker Hub profile</a>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1810" data-end="1813" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="1815" data-end="1877" class="">‚è≠Ô∏è 4. (Optional) <strong data-start="1837" data-end="1877">D√©ploiement sur un VPS (ex: Contabo)</strong></h4>
<p data-start="1879" data-end="1900" class="">If you have a server:</p>
<ul data-start="1901" data-end="2044">
<li data-start="1901" data-end="1965" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1903" data-end="1965" class="">Create secrets like <code data-start="1923" data-end="1933">SSH_HOST</code>, <code data-start="1935" data-end="1945">SSH_USER</code>, <code data-start="1947" data-end="1964">SSH_PRIVATE_KEY</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1966" data-end="2044" class="" style="">
<p data-start="1968" data-end="2044" class="">Add an SSH deployment step (let me know if you need help writing that part).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2046" data-end="2049" class="" style="">
<h4 data-start="2051" data-end="2105" class="">üìÑ 5. <strong data-start="2062" data-end="2105">Document this part in your final report</strong></h4>

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build-and-push-backend:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    # 1. R√©cup√©rer le code
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v3

    # 2. Setup Node.js pour tester ton backend
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v3
      with:
        node-version: 20

    # 3. Installation des d√©pendances
    - name: Install backend dependencies
      working-directory: ./backend
      run: npm install

    # 4. Lancer les tests (optionnel si tu as des tests)
    - name: Run backend tests
      working-directory: ./backend
      run: npm test || echo "no tests yet"

    # 5. Login Docker Hub
    - name: Docker Hub Login
      uses: docker/login-action@v3
      with:
        username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
        password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}

    # 6. Build &amp; Push Docker Image
    - name: Build &amp; Push backend Docker image
      run: |
        docker build -t ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}/user-management-backend:latest ./backend
        docker push ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}/user-management-backend:latest
